choices: Dragon (everyone knows what a dragon is)
Fifi (a blue skunk-like creature from Dumanuef's Glorious vore RPG)
1.content: Before the story can start you need to pick a creature's 'monster' side.
1.title: Welcome...

choices: A blind child lost in the woods
A man with a gun who shot at her
Another 'monster' but a diffrent kind than she was
112.content:
In a cave over looking a moderatly populated town, a young woman sat looking down at the city with sad eyes longing to join those walking among it. Down in the town a few people would occassionally look nervously towards where her cave was wondering if she was watching.

The girl sighed and went to get a drink of water from the berral that she had filled with rain water. Rain water was the only water source she could trust, several times the town had tried to kill her by posioning a nearby lake and stream. The girl's claws clicked as she walked across the cave and she dipped her clawed hands into the water to scoop out some to drink.

The girl looked at her reflection in the water and sighed looking at the black scales that coated her entire body. She looked at her face that was almost human aside from the fact it was unusually long, had two small horns poking out of her long white hair. and coated with scales. Looking at her reflection mad her frill-like ears droop and made her draconic eyes fill with sadness.

She splashed the water with the back of her clawed hand to disrupt her reflection and wrapped her wings and tail around herself as she cried. She didn't know why the town hated and feared her, she had never hurt anyone in anything other than self defense. She had tried walking into the town once but people had run from her screeming and men wearing blue uniforms had shot things at her that had hurt her a lot.

She had tried stealing clothes to see if that made them more comfertable around her but they still just ran from her. The girl sighed and walked out of her cave to go hunt, she still needed to eat, despite the risk of people constantly trying to attack her.

As she wondered carefully through the forest she soon came upon...
112.title: The dragoness

choices: Its getting late, how about I just take you to my home?
I'd rather not, I hate seeing all those people running from me
1121.content:
As the girl hunted through the woods looking for something to eat she stumbled across some rabits that fled upon seeing her. She chased after them and managed to catch four of them after a short chase and she smiled knowing that she wasn't going to starve at least.

She flinched as she heard something moving towards her through the woods and saw a human boy climbing up the hill. She quickly hid behind a tree and peaked at the boy from around it.

The boy didn't seem to have noticed her as she watched him he continued forward stumbling over almost everything in front of him. He was holding a white cane which he kept tapping the ground in front of him with it before he'd take a step. The girl had never seen anything like this before and found it somewhat comic and chuckled softly.

"Who's there?" the boy shouted his head turning to look right at her.

The girl shrieked and started to run when she heard the boy shout again, "Wait please don't go! I'm lost and can't find my way home!"

The dragon girl stopped and blinked turning back to look at the boy who seemed to be chasing after her the best he could. She was confused and asked, "You aren't afraid of me?"

"No," the boy said still staggering forward, "Why should I be? You probably could have killed me by now if you felt like it."

"Your right I mean you no harm," the girl said before saying sadly, "It's just that everyone else has run from me as soon as they saw me, your the first not to have run or attacked me."

"Well that might be in part because I can't see you," the boy said now just a feet from the girl, "I have no idea how anything looks unless I feel it."

The dragon girl took a step away from the boy as he reached out to her and said, "Please don't touch me."

"Why?" the boy asked sounding confused, "Are you a leper?"

"I don't think so," the dragon girl said, "I don't know what a leper is."

"So why don't you want me touching you?" the boy asked.

"Because if you have any idea how I look you might run from me just like all the others do," the dragon girl said sobbing a bit, "You're the only one so far who hasn't run from me and I'd like it to stay like that."

"Can you at least lead me back to the town so I can go home?" the boy asked.

The dragon girl debated for a bit before saying, "...
1121.title: Blind and without fear

choices: They arrived back at her cave and Brandon hears the click of her claws
11211.content:
"It's getting rather late for that," the dragon girl said nervously, "If I take you back to the town now I won't be able to make it back home before dark."

"You could stay with me and my family," the boy said.

"Is everyone in your family blind?" the dragon girl asked.

"No, just me." the boy said sighing.

"Then your family probably wouldn't be happy to see me," the dragon girl said sighing, "As soon as they see me with you they'll probably freak out and attack me just long enough to get you away from me before running."

"I'm sure they'll handle it better than that," the boy said.

"I'm not," the dragon girl sighed.

"Well then you can just lead me to your home and you can take me back tomorrow," the boy said walking towards the dragon girl and reaching out with his hand again, "Lead on."

"Follow my voice," the dragon girl said walking along back towards her cave humming as she walked.

"By the way my name's Brandon," the boy said, "What's your's?"

"As far as I know I don't have a name," the dragon girl said sadly, "I have never known who my parents were and no one else has ever called me anything but a monster. My mother or father might have named me before leaving me but I don't know what it is."

"Oh," Brandon said softly.

After a minute...
11211.title: Its getting late, how about I just take you to ...

choices: They arrive back at Sara's cave without insedent
A hunter rises out of the bush and shoots at Sara
112112.content:
After a minute of walking through the woods towards her cave and listening to the steady tap of Brandon's cane, the dragon girl heard Brandon speak again.

"How about Sara?" Brandon asked.

"What?" the dragon girl asked confused.

"You said you didn't have a name right," Brandon said, "So how about Sara?"

"Well I... I don't know," the dragon girl said nervously feeling suddenly uncomfertable.

"Well if you want I can pick another name," Brandon offered.

"No it not the name that's making me nervous," the dragon girl said quickly before sadly saying, "It's just the thought of having a name. It seems alomst pointless after so long of not having one since everyone who sees me always runs away before I can even say hello. So it's always sort of seemed pointless for me to have a name since as far as everyone else seems conserned my name might as well be monster."

"Well I can always call you Sara," Brandon said, "After all if I don't see you as a monster others might not either."

"Yes but you haven't seen just how monsterous I look," the dragon girl said sobbing.

Brandon reached for the dragon girl and she quickly moved away to avoid him feeling her scales. Brandon sighed and said, "Well wiether you want me to or not, I'm naming you Sara and calling you by that name. So lead on Sara, it's late and they say it might rain tonight."

"Thank you Brandon," Sara said getting up and allmost brushed her hand through his hair but stopped short and sighed before saying, "Well let's get going."

A few minutes later...
112112.title: Name for a dragon

1121121.content:
Sara sighed releaved as they arrived back in her cave with the rabits she had caught glad to be back home. However when her claws started clicking on the rock floor she froze wondering what Brandon thought that was.

"Are you wearing high heels?" Brandon asked walking into the cave and feeling the walls.

"Yes," Sara said sighing in relief, "I always wear high heels becase they got stuck on my feet and I can't get them off."

"I'll help try and get them off for you if you want," Brandon said moving forward.

"No thanks," Sara said quickly backing away.

"You're still afraid of what I'll think of you if I touch you aren't you?" Brandon asked.

"Yes," Sara said sadly, "I'm sorry but I can't help it."

"I understand," Brandon said feeling his way over to the bed and sitting down, "You feel like if anyone sees you they will run because that's what's always happened."

"That sounds about right," Sara said sadly, "So what do you feel like doing?"

"Well," Brandon said, "I feel rather...
1121121.title: Back home

choices: Brandon fingering one of her shed scales
Brandon being dragged away by another human
11211211.content:
"Well I had been gathering food when I found you so that shouldn't be to much of a problem," Sara said happily, "I hope you like rabbits."

"Rabbits?" Brandon asked making a wierd face, "We're having rabbits?"

"Well if you don't like that I can try to catch something else for you," Sara said hurriedly, "I can try and catch some birds or something bigger like a buck."

"No, no rabbit is fine!" Brandon said hurriedly, "It's just that most rabbits I know of are pets so it seems a little odd to me to hear of someone eating them. Really rabbits are fine."

"Oh that's good," Sara breathed releaved, "I'll go get some fire wood for us. I'll be right back Brandon, try not to get lost."

Sara all but danced as she moved through the forest and gathered good fire wood. She had a guest, possibly a friend! She had found someone who wasn't afraid of her, even if it was risky touching him. Having had a conversation with someone that wasn't a one way conversation about how she wasn't going to hurt anyone felt great.

She wanted everything to be perfect for Brandon and made sure to gather pleanty of firewood and all but sang with joy. Still Brandon had seemed a bit unsure about having rabbits so Sara killed a quail quickly before she carried the body and wood home.

When she arrived home she froze seeing...
11211211.title: Gathering wood (tree wood)

choices: demanded if she was a dragon
112112111.content:
Sara saw Brandon holding one of her black scales in his hands with intrest and felt herself grow cold with fear.

Sara had shed a couple days ago, and while she managed to get rid of most of her scales, she had obviously missed a few. Sara swollowed neverously and continued walking into her cave hoping that Brandon didn't realize that it was her scale and thought it belonged to something else.

Brandon turned to face Sara hearing her returning and start piling the wood together to make a fire and asked, "Do you know what this came from?"

"What came from what?" Sara asked pretending to be very interested in the fire she was making before asking, "Would you prefer quail over rabbit? I managed to catch one."

"Sure," Brandon said, "But really, this scale I'm holding, do you have any idea what it might have come from?"

"Oh it might have come from some reptile that happened to decide to use my cave as a place to shed," Sara said innocently, "they do that every once in a while."

"Not any reptile I've ever come across before," Brandon said, "This scale is huge! The sucker this came from must have been the size of a kamodo dragon!"

"I seriously doubt that," Sara said dismissing it quickly, "I've never encountered anything in these woods that big."

Sara lit the pile of wood she had made by blow some of her flaming breath over it. The fire roared up and began to burn merrily and Sara speared the quail and rabbits before putting them over the fire. Sara noticed that Brandon seemed to be staring in her general direction rather entently.

"What is it Brandon?" Sara asked praying he hadn't figured out it was her scale.

"How'd you light the fire like that?" Brandon asked, "It seems to have sprung up rather quickly."

"Oh dry wood is like that sometimes," Sara said cursing her stupidity, "It will just go off like a bomb sometimes."

"Maybe but I didn't hear you use any metods of lighting it," Brandon said.

"Well I lit it by my regular means," Sara said she would be sweating if she could, "I guess some might find it a bit odd."

Brandon looked at Sara for a few more moments before he...
112112111.title: Scale of Revelation

1121121112.content:
Brandon's eyes widened as he suddenly add things together. He realized that Sara had scales and could breath fire and there was only one creature he knew of that could do that, a dragon.

"Hey Sara," Nick said carefully slowly reaching for his cane, "Is it ok if I go walk around outside for a few minutes?"

Sara wondered at the question and looked at Brandon noticing that he looked a fraid and nervous suddenly. Sara sighed saddly and asked, "You've figured out what I am haven't you?"

Brandon suddenly leapt to his feet and ran for the cave entrance holding his cane out before him as if to make sure she wasn't there. Sara couldn't bare to see Brandon go since he was the only one that had spent some time with her.

Sara cried out, "Brandon please don't go!"

"You can't trick me anymore monster!" Brandon shouted, "You won't eat me!"

Sara felt tears run down her face at that and sobbed once watching Brandon continuing to run and...
1121121112.title: Brandon runs

choices: continued to try and pull free
11211211121.content:
Sara chased after Brandon with vigor knowing she couldn't let him get away. Not only did he know where she lived, which would be used to kill her, but she now needed his company even if it was force. She had been able to talk to someone and she did not want to give that up.

Sara soon caught up to Brandon as he continued to run in the general direction of the city trying to escape her.

"Brandon please stop!" Sara cried as she drew closer to Brandon.

Brandon wailed and only ran faster trying to out pace her. Sara sighed and flapped her wings to launch her forward and soon landed on Brandon's shoulders and drove him to the ground. Brandon wailed and began screeming for help as Sara lifted him off the ground and used one arm to hold him close to her. She used her tail to hold his legs together and force her free hand over his mouth to quiet him.

Brandon panicked feeling Sara's scales against his body and her claws poking his skin. Sara struggled up towards her home wobbling violently as she walked being unable to use her tail for balance. Sara grunted as she climbed over a log and hoped talking would calm Brandon down.

"Brandon, I'm really sorry I have to do this," Sara said her throat tightening, "But I'm afraid I can't let you go right now."

"Why so you can eat me!?!" Brain demanded pulling his mouth free for a second.

"I would never eat you Brandon," Sara said tears flowing down her scaly cheek, "I can't let you go because you know where I live and I enjoy your company."

Brandon tried to jerk free again but failed and Brandon...
11211211121.title: Recapturing Brandon

112112111211.content:
Brandon jabbed his elbow into Sara's gut which caused her to stagger but she kept her hold on Brandon as he continued to struggle.

As one of her tears dripped onto Brandon he tried to ram his head into hers, but his neck was to short to reach her head and he shouted, "Quit drooling on me you damned monster, can't you at least wait until I'm dead before you try and eat me."

"I'm not drooling," Sara choked causing more tears to fall onto Brandon, "I'm crying. I really thought I had made a friend with you but I don't want to be alone again, please stop this Brandon."

"I might be blind but I'm not stupid!" Brandon shouted, "You just lured me to your cave so that you could trap me and eat me after you'd got me nice and full on all that rabbit and quail!"

"Brandon please stop acting like this!" Sara shout as she tightened her grip as a reflex.

Sara heard a snap and Brandon suddenly fell limp in her arms and she whispered, "Brandon? Brandon are you ok?"

Sara let go of Brandon and he dropped to the ground, his neck snapped, and Sara began to wail into her hands. Sara grabbed hold of Brandon's dead body and...
112112111211.title: continued to try and pull free

choices: Began to think of herself as a monster
1121121112111.content:
Sara dragged Brandon's body to an area of soft ground where she began to dig and soon had a suitable grave dug for him and placed him in it. She thought about taking his body to town so that his family would know what had happened to him, but dismissed the idea.

If she took Brandon's body to town they would think that she had killed him, which she had but not meant to. But the town would think she had done so on perpous and would never see her as anything but a monster and might even begin to truily hunt her. So she sadly used her tail to push the dirt over Brandon's body as it started to rain just as she had predicted it would.

She took a large rock from nearby and forced it into the ground at the head of Brandon's grave and used her claws to write out,

Brandon
The Closest Thing to
a Friend I Ever Had.

May he Rest in Peace

Sara sobbed over the grave as she continued to whisper, "Brandon, I'm sorry, I'm so sorry."

Sara got up and began to walk back to her cave as the storm began to get worse and worse and soon got so bad that she would have been hopelessly lost if she didn't know the hill like she did her claws. As she started to draw closer to her cave she...
1121121112111.title: Brandon's funeral

choices: She must leave forever and trouble these people no longer.
She must kill herself to spare the world of her evil presence.
11211211121112.content:
Sara sobbed as her claws scraped the rock surface as she climbed using her strong arms and legs. She looked at her claws making deep rends in the smooth surface, scarring it permanently. Was that all they were good for? Bringing destruction to the land around her, and killing even when unintended. She climbed on, and the storm raged around her, threatening to throw her off the rock at any moment. She shivered as the cold rain hit her scales. They were strong, and protected her, but they were as cold as the rocks beneath her. Sara wished that instead, she could be a human, wrapped in warm clothing fit for such weather, but she knew she would never get her wish. She was doomed to remain as she was for her whole life.

Finally, she reached the cliff top, where the outlining of a dark cave could be seen. Quickly, Sara pulled herself up to the ledge and ran into the entrance. The rain no longer pounded on her back, but she still shivered in the cold. She uprooted a small tree using her strong arms, and used her fiery breath to set it aflame. she gathered herself into a small bundle and sat by the fire, warming herself, and thinking.

Her fire was useful to warm herself, but it had also frightened Brendan away, and if the flames ever found their way to any of the wooden houses below... she could not bear to think of what would happen then. Was that really what her breath was meant for? She gathered herself closer to the fire, tears streaming in her eyes.

She was a monster, just as the people told her.

Nothing she could do, no love she might have had, and no gentleness in her personality had prevented her from killing the only human who had ever come anywhere near her. Her claws were stained with his blood not because of her choice, but simply because of who she was. She knew why people ran from her now. If anyone ever decided to become her friend, they would always be in danger. if they let her into the town, even one mistake could set the entire village aflame.

She was a beast.

Her claws could do nothing but destroy. her fire could do nothing but destroy. Is that all she was? just a symbol of pain and destruction?

Sara knew what she had to do. Tears streamed down her face as she looked into the swaying tongues of fire. She had to do something. She was a monster, and she must help the people in the village by doing the one thing that she could do to help them.
11211211121112.title: This is who I am.

choices: A woman, investigating the strange cave
121.content:
The creature paced in his large 'burrow.' (more like an artificial cave than a burrow) His blue tail twitched as if to emphasize on his boredom. He stopped next to a nearly empty barrel of water he had stolen and looked at his reflection.
His appearance was 'unusual' to look at. The six foot tall creature's face was human, except for the furry blue ears sticking out of the top of his head and the sharp teeth filling his mouth, his arms and torso were also human-like but black claws stuck out of his finger-tips, also instead of feet he had blue paws and as mentioned a tail stuck out of his lower back. He wore old clothes he'd stolen from clothes lines, most of them were torn or stretched so that they would fit his unusual form.
The neko turned away from his reflection, it only reminded him of how he was treated when he had first shown himself to humans.
"What is that thing?!"
"It's a monster!"
"We have to get rid-"

His thoughts were suddenly interrupted by the sound of footsteps. 'Who or what would come into my burrow?' he wondered.
121.title: It begins...

choices: Whale (Meaning it has to be in water)

info.description:
The 'monster' half of the being can be any creature from any source, (mythology, video games, movies, etc) but make sure to put in the source if it's unique to a specific video game/movie/series.

As long as you keep it clean, in story (no 'junk' entries just to add chapters to your list, for example: ajabjasdf, seriously who adds that stuff?) and use decent grammar I won't delete.

Notes:
1. Vore is allowed
2. The creature can be a neko or an anthro, who-ever starts the storyline gets to choose. ^-^
